title: Orchestrate teams of Claude Code sessions
description: <Warning> Agent teams are experimental and disabled by default. Enable them by adding `CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS` to your [settings.json](/en/settings) or environment.

title: Track team usage with analytics
description: Claude Code provides analytics dashboards to help organizations understand developer usage patterns, track contribution metrics, and measure how Claude Code impacts engineering velocity.

title: Checkpointing
description: Claude Code automatically tracks Claude's file edits as you work, allowing you to quickly undo changes and rewind to previous states if anything gets off track.

title: Use Claude Code with Chrome (beta)
description: Claude Code integrates with the Claude in Chrome browser extension to give you browser automation capabilities from the CLI or the [VS Code extension](/en/vs-code#automate-browser-tasks-with-chrome).

title: Claude Code on the web
description: <Note> Claude Code on the web is currently in research preview. </Note> Claude Code on the web lets developers kick off Claude Code from the Claude app.

title: Common workflows
description: This page covers practical workflows for everyday development: exploring unfamiliar code, debugging, refactoring, writing tests, creating PRs, and managing sessions.

title: Manage costs effectively
description: Claude Code consumes tokens for each interaction. Costs vary based on codebase size, query complexity, and conversation length.

title: Data usage
description: **Consumer users (Free, Pro, and Max plans)**: We give you the choice to allow your data to be used to improve future Claude models.

title: Use Claude Code Desktop
description: The Code tab in the Desktop app lets you use Claude Code through a graphical interface instead of the terminal.

title: Get started with the desktop app
description: The desktop app gives you Claude Code with a graphical interface: visual diff review, parallel sessions with Git worktree isolation, file attachments, and the ability to run long-running tasks remo...

title: Discover and install prebuilt plugins through marketplaces
description: Plugins extend Claude Code with skills, agents, hooks, and MCP servers. Plugin marketplaces are catalogs that help you discover and install these extensions without building them yourself.

title: Speed up responses with fast mode
description: <Note> Fast mode is in [research preview](#research-preview). The feature, pricing, and availability may change based on feedback.

title: Extend Claude Code
description: Claude Code combines a model that reasons about your code with [built-in tools](/en/how-claude-code-works#tools) for file operations, search, execution, and web access.

title: Claude Code GitHub Actions
description: Claude Code GitHub Actions brings AI-powered automation to your GitHub workflow. With a simple `@claude` mention in any PR or issue, Claude can analyze your code, create pull requests, implement fe...

title: Claude Code GitLab CI/CD
description: <Info> Claude Code for GitLab CI/CD is currently in beta. Features and functionality may evolve as we refine the experience.

title: Run Claude Code programmatically
description: The [Agent SDK](https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agent-sdk/overview) gives you the same tools, agent loop, and context management that power Claude Code.

description: <Tip> For a quickstart guide with examples, see [Automate workflows with hooks](/en/hooks-guide). </Tip> Hooks are user-defined shell commands or LLM prompts that execute automatically at specific ...

title: Automate workflows with hooks
description: Hooks are user-defined shell commands that execute at specific points in Claude Code's lifecycle. They provide deterministic control over Claude Code's behavior, ensuring certain actions always hap...

title: How Claude Code works
description: Claude Code is an agentic assistant that runs in your terminal. While it excels at coding, it can help with anything you can do from the command line: writing docs, running builds, searching files,...

title: Interactive mode
description: <Note> Keyboard shortcuts may vary by platform and terminal. Press `?` to see available shortcuts for your environment.

title: JetBrains IDEs
description: Claude Code integrates with JetBrains IDEs through a dedicated plugin, providing features like interactive diff viewing, selection context sharing, and more.

title: Customize keyboard shortcuts
description: Claude Code supports customizable keyboard shortcuts. Run `/keybindings` to create or open your configuration file at `~/.claude/keybindings.json`.

title: Manage Claude's memory
description: Claude Code has two kinds of memory that persist across sessions: * **Auto memory**: Claude automatically saves useful context like project patterns, key commands, and your preferences.

title: Monitoring
description: Claude Code supports OpenTelemetry (OTel) metrics and events for monitoring and observability. All metrics are time series data exported via OpenTelemetry's standard metrics protocol, and events ar...

title: Enterprise network configuration
description: Claude Code supports various enterprise network and security configurations through environment variables.

title: Output styles
description: Output styles allow you to use Claude Code as any type of agent while keeping its core capabilities, such as running local scripts, reading/writing files, and tracking TODOs.

title: Claude Code overview
description: Claude Code is an AI-powered coding assistant that helps you build features, fix bugs, and automate development tasks.

title: Configure permissions
description: Claude Code supports fine-grained permissions so that you can specify exactly what the agent is allowed to do and what it cannot.

title: Create and distribute a plugin marketplace
description: A **plugin marketplace** is a catalog that lets you distribute plugins to others. Marketplaces provide centralized discovery, version tracking, automatic updates, and support for multiple source ty...

title: Create plugins
description: Plugins let you extend Claude Code with custom functionality that can be shared across projects and teams.

title: Plugins reference
description: <Tip> Looking to install plugins? See [Discover and install plugins](/en/discover-plugins).

title: Quickstart
description: This quickstart guide will have you using AI-powered coding assistance in just a few minutes. By the end, you'll understand how to use Claude Code for common development tasks.

title: Sandboxing
description: Claude Code features native sandboxing to provide a more secure environment for agent execution while reducing the need for constant permission prompts.

title: Security
description: Your code's security is paramount. Claude Code is built with security at its core, developed according to Anthropic's comprehensive security program.

title: Configure server-managed settings (public beta)
description: Server-managed settings allow administrators to centrally configure Claude Code through a web-based interface on Claude.ai.

title: Claude Code settings
description: Claude Code offers a variety of settings to configure its behavior to meet your needs. You can configure Claude Code by running the `/config` command when using the interactive REPL, which opens a ...

title: Extend Claude with skills
description: Skills extend what Claude can do. Create a `SKILL.md` file with instructions, and Claude adds it to its toolkit.

title: Claude Code in Slack
description: Claude Code in Slack brings the power of Claude Code directly into your Slack workspace. When you mention `@Claude` with a coding task, Claude automatically detects the intent and creates a Claude ...

title: Customize your status line
description: The status line is a customizable bar at the bottom of Claude Code that runs any shell script you configure.

title: Create custom subagents
description: Subagents are specialized AI assistants that handle specific types of tasks. Each subagent runs in its own context window with a custom system prompt, specific tool access, and independent permissi...

title: Optimize your terminal setup
description: Claude cannot control the theme of your terminal. That's handled by your terminal application.

title: Enterprise deployment overview
description: Organizations can deploy Claude Code through Anthropic directly or through a cloud provider. This page helps you choose the right configuration.

title: Troubleshooting
description: You might encounter the following issues in WSL: **OS/platform detection issues**: If you receive an error during installation, WSL may be using Windows `npm`.
